data.title: CFO Moves
data.text:
CFO Moves this week include:

Citrix Systems, Inc. Anworth Mortgage Asset Corporation Alpha Pro Tech, Ltd. Prime Meridian Holding Company HRG Group, Inc. LSB Industries, Inc.

Would you like to receive our weekly CFO Moves directly in your email? Click the SIGN ME UP! button on the right of the blog page.

Should you have any CFO Moves to report, please email us.

CFO Moves is published by Samuel Dergel (Executive Search Consultant and CFO & Financial Executive Search Specialist with Stanton Chase). Samuel can be reached by email at s.dergel@stantonchase.com or by phone at +1 (415) 738-2070.

+ + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + +

Citrix Systems, Inc. [SANTA CLARA, Calif.] (NASDAQ: CTXS) announced the election of Graham Smith, former CFO at Salesforce, to its board of directors. Mr. Smith has served as a director of Splunk since 2011 and was previously the executive vice president and chief financial officer for Salesforce, where he held other senior executive positions beginning in 2007. Prior to Salesforce, he served as chief financial officer at Advent Software. He sits on the boards of MINDBODY, Inc. and Xero, Inc. Mr. Smith, will serve on the Compensation Committee.

Anworth Mortgage Asset Corporation [SANTA MONICA, Calif.] (NYSE: ANH) announced that Thad M. Brown, the Company’s Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer and Secretary, will retire effective December 31, 2015. The Company also announced that Charles J. Siegel has been appointed by the board of directors of the Company to the positions of Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer and Secretary, effective January 1, 2016. Mr. Siegel joined the Company in October 2004 and has served as Senior Vice President-Finance since January 2005 and also as Assistant Secretary since May 2005. Prior to joining the Company, Mr. Siegel served as Chief Financial Officer with various mortgage originators for over 30 years. Mr. Siegel began his career with KPMG.

Alpha Pro Tech, Ltd. [NOGALES, AZ] (NYSE MKT: APT) announced that effective January 4, 2016, Lloyd Hoffman will assume the role of Chief Executive Officer and will also join the Company’s Board of Directors. Colleen McDonald will assume the role of Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Hoffman, who currently serves as CFO, has been with the Company since 1991, two years after the Company was founded. Ms. McDonald, who currently serves as Corporate Controller, has served with the Company for 20 years.

Prime Meridian Holding Co. [TALLAHASSEE, FL] (OTCQX: PMHG) and Prime Meridian Bank have appointed R. Randy Guemple to serve as CFO and principal financial officer, effective Jan. 1, 2016, coinciding with the retirement of their current CFO, Kathleen C. Jones. Guemple is Executive Vice President of PMHG’s whollyowned subsidiary, Prime Meridian Bank, and has served as a member of the Board of Directors of the Company since 2010 and the Board of Directors of the Bank since 2007. He will continue to serve in those capacities. Guemple has worked closely with Jones since July, 2015, as part of the planned transition. Guemple was formerly Executive Vice President, Chief Operating Officer, and Chief Financial Officer of First Bank of Florida in West Palm Beach, Florida where he also served on both the Bank and Holding Company Boards of Directors. He is a member and Past Chairman of the Board of Trustees for the Tallahassee Memorial Healthcare Foundation, Inc. He is a Director Emeritus of Elder Care Services, Inc. and served as the Executive Director of the Leon County Educational Facilities Authority.

HRG Group, Inc. [NEW YORK] appointed George C. Nicholson to the additional position of Acting Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Nicholson’s appointment as Acting Chief Financial Officer will be effective as of January 4, 2015. Prior to such appointment, Mr. Nicholson served as Senior Vice President and Chief Accounting Officer of the Company.

LSB Industries, Inc. [OKLAHOMA CITY] (NYSE: LXU) announced that it has appointed Interim Chief Executive Officer Daniel D. Greenwell as President and Chief Executive Officer. Mr. Greenwell has served as Interim Chief Executive Officer since September 2015. Mr. Greenwell has served as a Partner and Chief Financial Officer of a private equity investment and advisory firm since September 2014. Mr. Greenwell previously served as the Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President of Sabre Industries Inc. from April 2013 until May 2014. From January 2012 until March 2013, Mr. Greenwell served as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Tronox Limited. Prior to that, Mr. Greenwell served as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Terra Industries, Inc., from 2005 until its acquisition by CF Industries Holdings, Inc. in April 2010. He also served on the Board of Directors of Terra Nitrogen Company, L.P., a Master Limited Partnership, from March 2008 until April 2010. Mr. Greenwell has held various executive leadership positions at a number of public companies, including Belden Inc., Zoltek Companies Inc., and Sigma Chemical Company.

CFO Moves this week include:

RE/MAX Holdings, Inc. RetailMeNot, Inc. Clean Harbors, Inc. GSE Environmental Oak Valley Bancorp North Highland TWO MEN AND A TRUCK Evolving Systems, Inc. Compeat Infoblox Inc. Sage Growth Partners Allison Transmission Holdings Inc. Hancock Fabrics, Inc. Envision Business Consulting Protective Life Corporation Ophthotech Corporation Codiak BioSciences Inc. Good Start Genetics, Inc. eFileCabinet, Inc. BioDuro, LLC NetApp, Inc. Eldorado Resorts, Inc. Owens Realty Mortgage, Inc. EnerBank USA eBags SmartSource Computer & Audio Visual Rentals Ice Energy VECTRA Constellation West Scenic Hudson, Inc. Blue Coat Systems, Inc. DS Healthcare Group Meritage Homes Corporation

Would you like to receive our weekly CFO Moves directly in your email? Click the SIGN ME UP! button on the right of the blog page.

Should you have any CFO Moves to report, please email us.

CFO Moves is published by Samuel Dergel (Executive Search Consultant and CFO & Financial Executive Search Specialist with Stanton Chase). Samuel can be reached by email at s.dergel@stantonchase.com or by phone at +1 (415) 738-2070.

+ + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + +

RE/MAX Holdings, Inc. [DENVER] (NYSE: RMAX) appointed Karri Callahan, Vice President and Corporate Controller, to the position of CFO, after former CFO and COO Dave Metzger is retiring. Ms. Callahan joined RE/MAX in April 2013 as Senior Manager of SEC Reporting and was promoted to Vice President, Corporate Controller in June 2014. She served as the Company’s Acting Chief Accounting Officer from November 6, 2014 to January 26, 2015 and as Acting Chief Financial Officer from December 31, 2014 through January 26, 2015. Prior to joining RE/MAX, Ms. Callahan worked at Ernst & Young, LLP most recently as Senior Manager since 2008.

RetailMeNot, Inc. [AUSTIN, Texas] (NASDAQ: SALE) announced that J. Scott Di Valerio was appointed as its chief financial officer, replacing interim CFO Louis Agnese. In 2010, Scott joined Outerwall as the company’s chief financial officer, and served in that role until he was appointed CEO in late 2013. Prior to Outerwall, Scott served as president of the Americas for the Lenovo Group Limited, and he held senior positions at Microsoft Corporation as corporate vice president of Microsoft’s OEM division and as corporate vice president of finance and administration and chief accounting officer. Previously Scott served in management positions at The Walt Disney Company and Mindwave Software Inc., and as a partner at PricewaterhouseCoopers.

Clean Harbors, Inc. [NORWELL, Mass] (NYSE: CLH) announced the appointment of Michael L. Battles, as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer (CFO), as part of a planned transition. James M. Rutledge, the Company’s CFO since 2005, will remain in his role as Vice Chairman and President. Mr. Battles has served as the Company’s Senior Vice President, Corporate Controller and Chief Accounting Officer since 2013. Prior to Clean Harbors, Mike spent 12 years in a variety of senior financial positions at PerkinElmer Inc. Most recently, he was Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of PerkinElmer’s Human Health business. Prior to his role in Human Health, he served as Chief Accounting Officer for several years and Acting Chief Financial Officer during a one-year search period. Prior to PerkinElmer, Mike held several positions at Deloitte & Touche LLP from 1990 to 2001.

GSE Environmental [HOUSTON] announced that Thomas Wright will be the company’s new CFO. Thomas was formerly CFO and EVP of Sterling Construction. Previously, Thomas was CFO of St. Mary’s/CBM. Additionally, he has also held senior management positions with Boart Longyear, a drilling services and products manufacturer, Allied Signal, and others.

Oak Valley Bancorp [OAKDALE, CA] (NASDAQ: OVLY) announced the promotion of Jeff Gall as CFO, replacing Rick McCarty. Jeff has been the Vice President of Finance and Accounting for the Bank since 2006.

North Highland [ATLANTA] welcomes Beth Schiavo to the firm’s executive team as Chief Financial Officer. Previously, Schiavo served as assurance partner at Ernst & Young.

TWO MEN AND A TRUCK [LANSING, Mich] announced the promotion of Jeff Wesley from Chief Financial Officer to Chief Executive Officer.

Evolving Systems, Inc. [ENGLEWOOD, CO] (NASDAQ: EVOL) announced that Dan Moorhead, formerly Vice President, Finance and Administration, has been promoted to Chief Financial Officer. Previously Mr. Moorhead held various management positions at High Country Club, Convergent Communications and the public accounting firm of Malouff and Co.

Compeat [AUSTIN, Texas] announced that Kerry Carney joined the executive team as the company’s Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Carney joins Compeat from Profiles International.

Infoblox Inc. [SANTA CLARA, Calif.] (NYSE: BLOX) announced that Janesh Moorjani has joined Infoblox as executive vice president and chief financial officer. Moorjani joins Infoblox from VMware. Prior to VMware, Moorjani had a successful finance and sales career at Cisco. Previously, Moorjani worked at Goldman Sachs, rising to vice president in the firm’s merchant banking division in Silicon Valley.

Sage Growth Partners (SGP) [Baltimore, MD] announced the appointment of Melissa Pitchford as the firm’s first Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Prior to joining SGP in 2014, Ms. Pitchford was the CFO of Katzen Eye Group. From 2002-2011, Pitchford earned multiple promotions, shareholder status, and ultimately a position as chair of the medical practice group for KatzAbosch.

Allison Transmission Holdings Inc. [INDIANAPOLIS] (NYSE: ALSN) announced that David S. Graziosi, currently Chief Financial Officer, has been promoted to the additional role of President. Graziosi joined Allison in November 2007 as Executive Vice President, CFO and Treasurer, shortly after the Company’s sale by General Motors to The Carlyle Group and Onex Corporation. The company begins its search for a new CFO.

Hancock Fabrics, Inc. [BALDWYN, Miss.] (OTC: HKFI) announced the appointment of Rebecca I. Flick as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Ms. Flick currently serves as the Chairman – Finance Committee of the Marcus Autism Center Board of Trustees and is a director of the National Monuments Foundation Board and a member of the University of Tennessee Finance Department Advisory Board. From 2013 to September 2014, she served as Global Vice President – Finance and Treasurer at Recall Corporation, and from 2012 to 2013, she served as Enterprise Vice President – Finance and Treasurer at ServiceMaster Global Holdings, Inc. 2011 to 2012, Ms. Flick served as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at SecurAmerica, LLC. Prior to that she spent approximately 14 years at The Home Depot, Inc., in various positions, including Vice President – Finance and Treasurer.

Envision Business Consulting [DENVER] announced the addition of Colleen Kasch as its first official Chief Financial Officer. Kasch, a CPA, has worked with many mid-sized construction, development, service, architectural, venture capital, and other companies as CFO, Controller, and/or Consultant.

Protective Life Corporation [BIRMINGHAM, Ala.] announced that Steven G. Walker has been named Executive Vice President, Chief Financial Officer and Controller, replacing Richard J. Bielen, who has been named President and Chief Operating Officer of the Company. Walker will continue leading the accounting function at Protective in addition to his position as Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Walker joined Protective Life in 2002 and has served as the Chief Accounting Officer and Controller since 2003.

Ophthotech Corporation [NEW YORK] (NASDAQ: OPHT) announced that Glenn P. Sblendorio, a leading industry veteran, will be joining the Company as Executive Vice President, Chief Operating Officer and Chief Financial Officer, replacing Michael G. Atieh. Mr. Sblendorio is joining Ophthotech from The Medicines Company, where he most recently served as President and Chief Financial Officer. He has held a variety of senior management positions at Hoffmann-LaRoche, Inc., Eyetech Pharmaceuticals Inc. and MPM Capital Advisors, LLC. Mr. Sblendorio has served as a member of the Board of Directors and the Audit Committee Chairman of Ophthotech.

Codiak BioSciences Inc. [CAMBRIDGE, Mass.] announced that Linda Bain will be its first chief financial officer. Linda Bain joined Codiak from Avalanche Biotechnologies where, as chief financial officer, she led a successful IPO and follow-on financing. She previously served as vice president of finance, business operations and treasurer at Bluebird Bio. Ms. Bain has held senior roles at Genzyme Corporation, including vice president of finance, global manufacturing and operations and vice president of finance of Genzyme Genetics. Earlier in her career, she served in senior finance roles at Fidelity Investments and AstraZeneca Pharmaceuticals and as an auditor at Deloitte & Touche.

Good Start Genetics Inc. [CAMBRIDGE, Mass] a commercial-stage molecular genetics information company, announced today that it has appointed Marc Jones to the post of chief financial officer (CFO). Jones joins Good Start Genetics from T2. Previously, Jones served as chief financial officer of Crashlytics, Ivenix and CHiL Semiconductor.

eFileCabinet, Inc. [LEHI, Utah] is pleased to announce Alan Taylor has accepted the position of Chief Financial Officer. Taylor assumes the CFO role previously held by Jeff Coulter, who will now serve as COO of the company. Most recently, Taylor comes from Adaptive Computing Enterprises, and also has experience working with companies like Helius, Novell, Honeywell, Ford Motor Company, and Boeing.

BioDuro, LLC [SAN DIEGO] announced the appointment of Ian R Wisenberg as Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Wisenberg joins the company after having served for the past seven years as Managing Director of BioGlobal Consulting Group where he worked closely with several growth companies including Genalyte, Intrinsic Lifesciences, Excaliard Pharmaceuticals, and more recently Molecular Response and Formex. Mr. Wisenberg also served as Chief Business Officer for the Biotech Investment Group. From January 2009 to December 2012, Mr. Wisenberg served as Managing Director for ChinaBio Capital Partners.

NetApp, Inc. [SUNNYVALE, CA] (NASDAQ: NTAP) announced that its CFO, Nick Noviello has decided to pursue another opportunity. Jeffrey Bergmann, vice president of corporate finance, will assume the role of interim chief financial officer. Jeffrey Bergmann joined NetApp in June 2009 as vice president of global tax. Since August 2015, Mr. Bergman has served as NetApp’s vice president of corporate finance. From 2003 to 2008, Mr. Bergman was senior vice president, tax and administration at Verisign, Inc. Prior to 2003, Mr. Bergmann was a federal tax partner at KPMG LLP.

Eldorado Resorts, Inc. [RENO, Nev] (NASDAQ: ERI) Chief Financial Officer, Bob Jones, announced his intention to retire, effective March 15, 2016. Tom Reeg, President of Eldorado Resorts Inc., will assume the additional title and responsibilities of Chief Financial Officer upon Mr. Jones’ retirement.

Owens Realty Mortgage, Inc. [WALNUT CREEK, CA] (NYSE MKT: ORM) announced that Bryan Draper, Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer of ORM, has been promoted President and Chief Executive Officer. Melina Platt will be succeeding him as Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer of the Company. Ms. Platt has been the Controller of the manager since May 1998 and was previously a Senior Manager with KPMG in the San Francisco Bay Area practice.

EnerBank USA [SALT LAKE CITY] announced Kristin Dittmer will assume the role of Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, replacing Charlie Knadler, who was promoted President and CEO. Dittmer was previously Executive Vice President of Finance and Credit at EnerBank. She joined EnerBank in 2010 as Senior Vice President and Chief Credit Officer. Previously she served as Chief Credit Officer of BMW Bank of North America. She began her banking career as a Financial Examiner for the Utah Department of Financial Institutions.

eBags [DENVER] announced the appointment of Dan Hogan as the company’s Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Chief Operating Officer (COO). Hogan joins the company with a solid history of executive leadership. He spent nine years at the Coleman Company where he was CFO and COO. Prior to Coleman, Hogan had senior operations roles at Easton-Bell Sports and World Kitchen, whose brands include Corningware, Corelle, Pyrex, Ecko, and Revere. Earlier in his career, he was Vice President, Finance, at a division of Georgia Pacific as well as at the Fort James Corporation.

SmartSource Computer & Audio Visual Rentals [HAUPPAUGE, N.Y.] announced that Stephen Rupolo, the company’s Chief Financial Officer (CFO), will move to a newly-created position as Vice President – Product Strategy. Rupolo joined SmartSource Rentals as the Corporate Controller in 1987. In 1996, he was named Vice President and in 2004, he was promoted to Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer (CFO).

Ice Energy [SANTA BARBARA, CA] has hired Charles Costenbader as its new Chief Financial Officer. Costenbader most recently served as Chief Operating Officer of Synthesis Energy Systems, based in Shanghai, China. Prior to that he was Chief Financial Officer. He has 25 years of physical asset operations and commodity risk management experience in the power generation, refining, natural gas storage, biofuels, and renewable energy sectors. This includes 10 years in the Structured Finance Group of GE Capital and energy commodities at Macquarie Bank.

VECTRA [ST. LOUIS] formerly OM Group, Inc., announced that Manavendra Sial has been appointed its Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Manavendra brings over 20 years of experience from SunEdison, Inc. and General Electric (GE). Most recently, Mr. Sial served as Senior Vice President-Finance and Deputy Chief Financial Officer for SunEdison. Prior to that, he served as Chief Operating Officer for SunEdison’s APAC andSouth Africa business. Manavendra also held various financial and management positions at GE, most recently as the CFO for GE’s Power Delivery business.

Constellation West [WASHINGTON] announced that Dale Stucke has joined the company as chief financial officer. Stucke is a seasoned finance executive and certified public accountant with more than 25 years of experience with Fortune 500, small and private corporations, including some of the largest leaders in government industry such as BearingPoint, Booz Allen Hamilton, General Dynamics, GTSI Corp., Unisys and, most recently, USIS.

Scenic Hudson [HUDSON VALLEY, N.Y.] has named Jason Camporese of Hopewell Junction as the nonprofit group’s new chief finance officer. Mr. Camporese began his career in public accounting, where he served as an audit manager and senior auditor during a seven-year tenure with firms in New York City and White Plains. After his time in public accounting, Mr. Camporese spent four years as finance director of the New York City-based nonprofit sports and fitness center Asphalt Green.

Blue Coat Systems, Inc. [SUNNYVALE, CA] introduced new chief financial officer (CFO), Nick Noviello, replacing Gregg Hampton. Noviello has over 20 years of leadership experience in financial and operational roles. At NetApp, which he joined in 2008, and was CFO for the last four years. Prior to joining NetApp, Noviello spent eight years at Honeywell International.

DS Healthcare Group [Pompano Beach, Fla.] Mark Brockelman has joined the company and will oversee all aspects of the financial departments within the organization. Prior to joining DS Healthcare, Brockelman served as the Chief Financial Officer for National Dentex Corporation as well as the Senior Vice President/Chief Financial and Administrative Officer of the Miami Dolphins and SunLife Stadium. He also served as the Chief Financial Officer at eScreen, Inc. Prior experience also includes four years as the Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at Ascend Media LLC. He previously spent five years at American Media, Inc. (AMI). Mark was AMI’s Vice President of Finance and Chief Accounting Officer. In his early career, Brockelman spent seven years at Arthur Andersen LLP in Chicago and West Palm Beach, culminating in his role as a Senior Audit Manager.

Meritage Homes Corporation [SCOTTSDALE, AZ] (NYSE: MTH) announced that Larry W. Seay, executive vice president and chief financial officer, will retire on March 31, 2016, concluding a 30-year career in homebuilding. Mr. Seay will be succeeded by Hilla Sferruzza, Meritage’s current senior vice president and chief accounting officer. Sferruzza joined Meritage in 2006 to be corporate controller in charge of the company’s accounting and financial reporting functions. She was named chief accounting officer in 2010 and senior vice president in 2013.

CFO Moves this week include:

FTI Consulting, Inc. TiVo Inc. Jobvite Informatica Taulia Inc. UFC APQC Applied Micro Circuits Corporation Church Mutual Insurance Company HealthWarehouse.com, Inc. AMETEK, Inc. Anaplan Tegile Systems Antares Capital CollabNet Crystal Rock Holdings, Inc. MetricStream Legacy Education Alliance, Inc. Catapult Learning, Inc. Captivate Hydrocarb Energy Corporation LiveOps Cloud Nuo Therapeutics, Inc. Anki Venminder Jaguar Growth Partners Healogics, Inc. Aquantia FusionHealth SessionM Pioneer Power Solutions, Inc. Montefiore Health System Vince Holding Corp. Education Management Corporation SmartSource Computer & Audio Visual Rentals U.S. Concrete, Inc. Isle of Capri Casinos, Inc. First Business Financial Services, Inc. Virtus Pharmaceuticals American Science and Engineering, Inc. Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust, Inc. BioBlast Pharma Ltd. Commonwealth Engineers, Inc. Carver Bancorp, Inc. Liberty TripAdvisor Holdings, Inc.

CFO Moves is published by Samuel Dergel (Executive Search Consultant and CFO & Financial Executive Search Specialist with Stanton Chase). Samuel can be reached by email at s.dergel@stantonchase.com or by phone at +1 (415) 738-2070.

+ + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + +

FTI Consulting, Inc. [Washington, D.C.] (NYSE: FCN) announced that its Chief Financial Officer, David M. Johnson will leave the Company on February 29, 2016, to accept a position as Chief Financial Officer of the International Rescue Committee. Mr. Johnson will continue as the Chief Financial Officer of FTI Consulting until his departure date and will complete the preparation and filing of the Company’s Annual Report.

TiVo Inc. [SAN JOSE, CA] (NASDAQ: TIVO) has named Naveen Chopra, the company’s chief financial officer, interim chief executive officer, effective January 30, 2016. Mr. Chopra has been with TiVo since 2003, serving most recently as its chief financial officer while also leading the company’s corporate development and strategy initiatives. Before joining TiVo, Chopra held a variety of business development and product marketing roles at HP, Microsoft, Moxi Digital, Ispiri and Ofoto.

Jobvite [SAN MATEO, CA] announced the appointment of Peter Maloney as the company’s new Chief Financial Officer. Peter’s previous experience includes: CFO of E2Open, CFO of SNOCAP, Inc. and CFO of Keynote Systems, Inc.

Informatica [Redwood City, Calif.] announced it has appointed Doug Barnett as executive vice president and chief financial officer. Prior to Informatica, Barnett was the executive vice president and chief financial officer at TriZetto Corporation. Prior to TriZetto, Barnett was a managing director and chief financial officer of AlixPartners. Before joining AlixPartners, Barnett was senior vice president of Finance for UGS PLM Software (acquired by Siemens).

Taulia Inc. [SAN FRANCISCO, CA] named John Varughese as CFO. Varughese joins Taulia from Perella Weinberg Partners, where he served as a partner in the advisory business. Prior to Perella, Varughese was a managing director at Lehman Brothers, where he led investment banking teams for many of the firm’s largest technology clients.

UFC (Ultimate Fighting Championship) announced Nakisa Bidarian as the organization’s new Chief Financial Officer. Bidarian was formerly UFC’s Executive Vice President of Strategy and Business Ventures. Prior to joining UFC, Bidarian led international real estate and hospitality investment and asset management for Mubadala Development Company. Before Mubadala, he was an investment banker at Morgan Stanley and Citigroup, specializing in merger and acquisitions.

APQC [HOUSTON] announced that Mike Hinson has joined the organization as chief financial officer. APQC’s longtime CFO Mike Shea will assist with the transition until his retirement on March 1, 2016, after 28 years with the organization. Prior to joining APQC, Hinson spent more than four years as the president and chief executive officer of Wright Therapy Products, Inc. He gained extensive sales, finance, and international experience in leadership roles at Bayer Healthcare (MEDRAD), Sony Electronics, ARCO International Oil & Gas, and KPMG.

Applied Micro Circuits Corporation [SANTA CLARA, Calif.] (NASDAQ: AMCC) announced the appointment of Martin S. McDermut as Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Mr. McDermut replaces Karen Rogge who served as interim chief financial officer since August 2015. Mr. McDermut was most recently senior vice president, finance and chief financial officer of Vitesse Semiconductor Corporation from August 2011 until April 2015, when the company was acquired by Microsemi Corporation. Mr. McDermut also served as chief financial officer for publicly traded companies including Iris International Inc. and Superconductor Technologies Inc. He was a partner at the public accounting firm of Coopers & Lybrand (now known as PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP), where he was the practice leader of the firm’s Los Angeles Entrepreneurial Advisory Services group.

Church Mutual Insurance Company [MERRILL, Wis.] announced the promotion of Kevin Root to Senior Vice President – Operations and Jeffrey Steffen to Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Kevin Root joined Church Mutual in September 2012 as vice president and chief financial officer. Jeff Steffen brings 22 years of business and insurance experience to the CFO position, including three years as Church Mutual’s director of financial planning and analysis.

HealthWarehouse.com, Inc. [CINCINNATI] (OTC: HEWA) announced that it has appointed Daniel Seliga as Chief Operating Officer and Chief Financial Officer. Prior to joining the Company full time, Mr. Seliga was a Managing Director of Melrose Capital, the Company’s senior lender. From September 2010 to December 2012, he was General Manager and Business Manager for MVI Enterprises. From November 1996 to July 2010, Mr. Seliga was the Chief Financial Officer and Vice President of Operations for Mae Holding Company. Prior to 1996, Mr. Seliga served as a commercial and real estate lending officer for Bank of New York and PNC Bank.

AMETEK, Inc. [BERWYN, Pa.] (NYSE: AME) announced the appointment of William J. Burke as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective May 15, 2016. Mr. Burke currently serves as Senior Vice President, Comptroller & Treasurer. He will replace Robert R. Mandos, Jr. who has announced his retirement after 35 very successful years with AMETEK. Mr. Burke joined AMETEK in 1987 and served in a number of financial, operational and business unit management roles prior to being named Vice President, Investor & Corporate Relations in 1999. He was named Vice President, Investor Relations and Treasurer in 2007 and in 2012 was elected to his current role as Senior Vice President, Comptroller & Treasurer.

Anaplan [SAN FRANCISCO] announced the appointment of James Budge, former Genesys and Rovi CFO and COO, as its Chief Financial Officer.

Tegile Systems [NEWARK, Calif.] announced the appointment of Michael Morgan as Chief Financial Officer. Most recently Morgan served as the CFO of Panzura. Before that, he held the CFO position at Model N. Morgan has also served as CFO of BackWeb Technologies, and led two IPOs including Talarian, which was sold to Tibco Software.

Antares Capital [CHICAGO] announced that it hired Barry Giarraputo as chief financial officer. Mr. Giarraputo joins Antares from 40 North Management where he served as chief operating officer. Prior to that role, Mr. Giarraputo was with Apollo Global Management as an executive officer, chief accounting officer and controller, and CFO at various Apollo subsidiaries.

CollabNet [SOUTH SAN FRANCISCO, Calif.] announced the addition of Amir Ameri as chief financial officer. Ameri joins CollabNet from Precise Software, where he served as CFO. Prior to Precise, Ameri was CFO of EnergyConnect. He also served as CFO and VP of operations for Aperto Networks and CFO and VP of finance and administration of Resumix.

Crystal Rock Holdings, Inc. [WATERTOWN, CT] (NYSE MKT: CRVP) announced the promotion of David Jurasek to Chief Financial Officer. Most recently, Jurasek has served the last four years as Crystal Rock’s Vice President of Finance. Beginning at Crystal Rock in 1995, Jurasek has served in various financial and insurance capacities including the merger between Crystal Rock and Vermont Pure in 2000. Prior to Crystal Rock, he worked as Director of Finance for Nuclear Energy Services.

MetricStream [PALO ALTO, Calif.] announced the appointment of Bert Clement as Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Most recently, Mr. Clement served as the Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer at Atrenta. Prior to Atrenta, he held the Senior Vice President, CFO and Controller titles at VeriSign. Mr. Clement has also held executive positions at MCI Telecommunications, Broad Point Communications, and Network Solutions.

Legacy Education Alliance, Inc. [CAPE CORAL, Fla.] (OTC: LEAI) appointed Christian A. J. Baeza to Chief Financial Officer (“CFO”) of its Company. Mr. Baeza was formerly the Company’s Interim CFO from June 2015 and Vice President and Corporate Controller from April 2015. From 2008 to 2014, Mr. Baeza held various senior finance positions, including Director of Financial Reporting and Assistant Corporate Controller, at Kraton Performance Polymers, Inc. Mr. Baeza held various finance positions from 2003 to 2008 at Spectra Energy Corp.

Catapult Learning, Inc. [CAMDEN, N.J.] announced the promotion of Andrea Vargas to President of the company’s Schools Division. Ms. Vargas most recently served as Corporate Chief Financial Officer, a position she assumed following Catapult Learning’s merger with Specialized Education Services, Inc. (SESI) in July 2015. From 2004 to 2015, Ms. Vargas held several leadership roles with SESI, including Controller, Chief Accounting Officer, and Vice President of Finance. Prior to her tenure at SESI, she worked in various finance and accounting functions at several large corporations, including United Technologies.

Captivate [NEW YORK] announced Harris Hwang as Chief Financial Officer. Hwang brings 20+ years of financial experience and leadership from top corporations, including Getty Images, BlackRock and Merrill Lynch. Hwang was promoted from Executive Vice President, Strategic Planning and Corporate Development.

Hydrocarb Energy Corporation [HOUSTON] (OTC: HECC) announced that K. Andrew Lai has joined the Company’s executive management team as its new Chief Financial Officer. From January 2013 to December 2015, Mr. Lai was an international financial consultant working mainly with oil and gas and real estate investors from China. From January 2011 to December 2012, Mr. Lai was the Chief Financial Officer of Lucas Energy, Inc. in Houston, Texas. From May 2010 to December 2010, Mr. Lai was an international business consultant. From October 2007 to April 2010, Mr. Lai served as Chief Financial Officer with Far East Energy Corporation in Houston. Mr. Lai joined Far East in 2007 and served as a member of Far East’s management team until his appointment as Chief Financial Officer. From 1999 to 2007, Mr. Lai held various managerial positions with EOG Resources, Inc., in Houston, including Financial Reporting Director and International Accounting Director. From 1987 to 1998, Mr. Lai held various positions with UMC Petroleum Corp. (which subsequently merged into Devon Energy).

LiveOps Cloud [AUSTIN, Texas] announced that Jeff Byal has joined as Chief Financial Officer (CFO). He most recently served as the CFO and Interim CEO at NewComLink. Prior to NewComLink, he was the Senior Vice President and Chief Accounting Officer at EZCORP, Inc. He has also held CFO roles and other financial leadership positions at companies including MSI Systems Integrators, Pamida, GiftCertificates.com, Gordmans and Appriss.

Nuo Therapeutics, Inc. [GAITHERSBURG, Md.] (OTC: NUOT) announced the appointment of the Company’s Acting Chief Financial Officer, David E. Jorden, as the Company’s Acting Chief Executive Officer.

Anki [SAN FRANCISCO] appointed Dominic Ruso as Chief Financial Officer. Ruso was formerly the CFO at Beats by Dr. Dre. Prior to Beats, Ruso was the Channel Controller for EMEIA and held senior positions in Sales Finance in Cupertino. Before joining Apple, he spent many years at Cisco Systems, Inc., holding various senior positions in Finance and Operations.

Venminder [ELIZABETHTOWN, KY] announced Michael Campbell will join as chief financial officer.

Jaguar Growth Partners [NEW YORK] announced the appointment of Ian Wilkin as Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer. Prior to joining Jaguar, Mr. Wilkin was Head of Decision Support for Real Estate & Infrastructure at the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA). Prior to ADIA, Mr. Wilkin worked with Ernst & Young (EY) in the United Kingdom.

Healogics, Inc. [JACKSONVILLE, Fla.] announced that David Bassin has joined the company as chief financial officer. Bassin most recently served as chief financial officer at eviCore Healthcare, Inc. (MedSolutions, Inc.). Previously, David was the chief financial officer at Inventiv Health where he spent eleven years progressing in multiple financial roles.

Aquantia [SAN JOSE, Calif.] announced Mark Voll has been appointed the company’s chief financial officer. Most recently, he was CFO at Montage Technology Group. Additionally, he was chief financial officer of MoSys, Inc. from June 2002 to November 2005 and also from March 1998 to June 2000.

FusionHealth [ATLANTA] appointed Mike McCloskey as its Chief Financial Officer. Before joining FusionHealth, McCloskey was the CFO for Norcross-based TransCentra, Inc. McCloskey was also CFO of Atlanta-based Parkmobile USA, Inc. Additionally, McCloskey held several senior level finance positions with organizations like Harland Clarke, where he was Vice President of Finance Operations.

SessionM [BOSTON] announced that it has hired Todd Donahue as chief financial officer. Donahue joins SessionM from erecruit, where he served as CFO and COO. Prior to erecruit, Donahue held several senior finance and operating roles including CFO at Livewire Mobile, Chief Accounting Officer at NMS Communications and VP Product Operations and VP Finance at Aspen Technology.

Pioneer Power Solutions, Inc. [FORT LEE, N.J.] (NASDAQ: PPSI) announced that Thomas Klink, President of Pioneer’s Jefferson Electric Segment and an experienced financial executive, has been promoted to Chief Financial Officer of Pioneer Power Solutions, Inc. He succeeds Andrew Minkow, who has resigned from Pioneer, as both an officer and a director, to pursue other professional opportunities. Most recently, Mr. Klink was President of Jefferson Electric, rising to that position after serving in several positions of increasing responsibility, including chief executive officer, chief financial officer, vice president, treasurer, secretary and chairman of the board of directors. Previously, from 1994 to 1996, Mr. Klink served as a division controller at MagneTek, Inc.

Montefiore Health System (MHS) [NEW YORK] appointed Colleen M. Blye as executive vice president and chief financial officer. Ms. Blye joins Montefiore from Catholic Health Services of Long Island (CHS), where she served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Earlier in her career, she was Executive Vice President for Finance and Integrated Services at Catholic Health Initiatives, a health system with 78 hospitals in 20 states.

Vince Holding Corp. [NEW YORK] (NYSE: VNCE) announced the appointment of David Stefko to the position of Chief Financial Officer of the Company. Mr. Stefko previously held the position of Interim CFO and Treasurer. Mr. Stefko has 28 years of senior finance and executive management experience and until being named Interim Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer, held the position of Group CFO at Sun Capital Partners. Prior to joining Sun Capital, he served as SVP, CFO & CAO of Things Remembered.

Education Management Corporation [PITTSBURGH] announced that Mick J. Beekhuizen will be stepping down as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective February 29. Frank Jalufka will replace Mr. Beekhuizen as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Jalufka most recently served as the Vice President, Chief Operating Officer and Chief Financial Officer at The Dolan Company.

SmartSource Computer & Audio Visual Rentals [HAUPPAUGE, N.Y.] announced that Sanjay Kapur has joined the company as the new Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Vice President (VP) of Finance. He succeeds CFO Stephen Rupolo, who is now leading corporate product, pricing and asset management strategy in the newly created position of Vice President – Product Strategy. Prior to joining SmartSource Rentals, Kapur spent almost 20 years with Arrow Electronics, Inc., serving most recently as the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Director of Finance for A.E. Petsche (an Arrow Electronics Company based in Arlington, TX). In addition to his role as CFO for Petsche, Kapur has held multiple executive operating roles at Arrow in areas of finance, sales management, marketing and procurement. Prior to Arrow, Kapur spent five years with McKinsey & Company (Houston, TX) and two years with PricewaterhouseCoopers (Pittsburgh, PA).

U.S. Concrete, Inc. [EULESS, TX] (NASDAQ: USCR) announced that it has hired Joseph C. “Jody” Tusa, Jr. as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Tusa was most recently the CFO of Emerge Energy Services LP. Tusa’s diverse financial experience also includes CFO roles at USA Compression Partners, LP, COMSYS IT Partners, Inc., and DSM Copolymer, Inc., along with senior leadership positions at Metamor Worldwide, Inc. and TOTAL American Mining, Inc.

Isle of Capri Casinos, Inc. [ST. LOUIS, MO] (NASDAQ: ISLE) announced that Eric Hausler, Isle’s chief financial officer, will become chief executive officer; Hausler was named chief financial officer in July 2014. Prior to that, he served as chief strategic officer from 2011 to 2014 and senior vice president, strategic initiatives from 2009 to 2011. Before joining Isle, Hausler served as senior vice president of development for another gaming company and held various positions on Wall Street covering the gaming, lodging and leisure industries.

First Business Financial Services, Inc. [MADISON, WI] (NASDAQ: FBIZ) announced the appointment of Edward G. Sloane, Jr. as Chief Financial Officer. Sloane brings to First Business more than 30 years of financial services experience, most recently serving as Executive Vice President, Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer with Peoples Bancorp, Inc. Prior to that, he spent 19 years with WesBanco, Inc., a financial services company in Wheeling, West Virginia, where he held the positions of Senior Vice President – Strategic Planning & Analysis, Senior Vice President – Controller, and other roles. Sloane will replace First Business Chief Financial Officer James Ropella, who will continue in the roles of Senior Vice President and Treasurer to facilitate the transition of the Chief Financial Officer position to Mr. Sloane.

Virtus Pharmaceuticals [TAMPA, Fl.] hired Damian Finio as Chief Financial Officer. Finio was previously SVP Finance at Heritage Pharmaceuticals, and has previous senior finance experience with West-Ward Pharmaceuticals, Daiichi Sankyo Pharma Development after spending over 14 year with AstraZeneca in various finance roles.

American Science and Engineering, Inc. (“AS&E”) [BILLERICA, Mass.] (NASDAQ: ASEI) announced the appointment of Diane Basile as Senior Vice President, Chief Financial Officer (CFO), and Treasurer of the Company. Basile succeeds Kenneth Galaznik, who has served in those roles since 2008 and is retiring following the end of the current fiscal year, as previously announced. Prior to joining the company, Basile served as CFO of Intronis. Previously, she was Vice President of Finance for Nuance Communications’ Healthcare Division, and held senior financial posts at technology firms including Mercury Computer and PerkinElmer.

Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust, Inc. [Virginia Beach, VA] (NASDAQ:WHLR) announced that Wilkes Graham will join the Company as its Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Graham will succeed Steven Belote, who will remain with the Company as its Chief Operating Officer. Since 2010 Mr. Graham has worked with Compass Point Research & Trading, LLC where he served as Director of Research and as a Senior Sell-Side Equity Research Analyst. Prior to joining Compass Point, Mr. Graham worked as a Vice President and a Senior Sell-Side Analyst focused on the real estate sector at FBR Capital Markets & Co. Previously, he worked as a Research Associate covering REITs for Raymond James & Associates.

BioBlast Pharma Ltd. [NEW HAVEN, Conn.] (NASDAQ: ORPN) announced that it has appointed Robert (Bob) Cook to the position of Chief Financial Officer (CFO). As previously announced, Udi Gilboa, co-founder of the Company, who until today was the CFO, will now transition to a special advisor role reporting to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO), and will continue as a member of the Company’s board of directors. Mr. Cook most recently served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Strata Skin Sciences, formerly Mela Sciences. Mr. Cook’s prior pharma experience includes ten years as the CFO of Immune Pharmaceuticals and its predecessor EpiCept Corporation, including one year as Interim President and CEO of EpiCept. Prior to that he served six years as CFO at Pharmos Corporation.

Commonwealth Engineers, Inc. [INDIANAPOLIS, IN] announced the promotion of Ann Dryer to Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Corporate Treasurer. Ann has worked for Commonwealth since 2001

Carver Bancorp, Inc. [NEW YORK] (NASDAQ: CARV), the holding company for Carver Federal Savings Bank, announced that David Toner will be stepping down as Chief Financial Officer, effective on or about February 18, 2016, to pursue other opportunities. Mr. Toner will continue to serve as CFO until that time and will assist with the transition. Mr. Toner joined Carver Bancorp, Inc. in 2009 and has served as CFO since 2013.

Liberty TripAdvisor Holdings, Inc. [Englewood, Colorado] announced that Christopher W. Shean resigned as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. The Company appointed Brian J. Wendling to serve as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Wendling has been Vice President and Controller of the Company since August 2014. He has also served as Vice President and Controller of Liberty Media Corporation since January 2013 and Liberty Interactive Corporation for more than the past five years. Prior thereto, Mr. Wendling held various positions with these companies and their predecessors since 1999. He has also served as Vice President and Controller of Liberty Broadband Corporation since October 2014.

Virgin Hotels [MIAMI] announced Dan Mathewes as Chief Financial Officer. Mathewes’ background includes senior financial positions at The World, Kerzner International Holdings Limited, Norwegian Cruise Lines and Royal Caribbean Cruises Limited.

Evite [LOS ANGELES] announced that Paul Pucino has been named Chief Financial Officer. Pucino brings over 30 years of experience in accounting and financial operations to Evite. For the past 15 years, he has served as the Chief Financial Officer of a number of publicly-traded and privately-held companies including THQ, Digital Insight and Tekelec.

The Phoenix Companies, Inc. (NYSE: PNX) [HARTFORD, Conn.] intends to appoint Ernest McNeill Jr., currently senior vice president and chief accounting officer at Phoenix, as chief financial officer, replacing current CFO Bonnie J. Malley, who is leaving to join another organization. Mr. McNeill joined Phoenix in August, 2014 and currently oversees numerous corporate finance functions. He previously held senior accounting and finance positions at Fidelity Investments and the Hartford Financial Services Group.

Aaron’s, Inc. (NYSE: AAN) [ATLANTA] announced that Steven A. Michaels, President, has been named Aaron’s Chief Financial Officer and President of Strategic Operations, succeeding Gilbert L. Danielson. Michaels currently serves as Aaron’s President. Prior to being named President, Michaels was VP, Strategic Planning and Business Development. Since joining Aaron’s in 1995, Michaels has held various roles within the organization, starting in audit and progressing through the franchise and finance departments.

TheStreet, Inc. (NASDAQ: TST) [NEW YORK] announced that Eric F. Lundberg has joined the Company as Chief Financial Officer. He succeeds Richard Broitman, who will cease to serve as the Company’s Interim Chief Financial Officer and will continue his employment with the Company as Chief Accounting Officer. Mr. Lundberg recently held the position of Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of ALM Media, LLC, from January 2008 to January 2015. Mr. Lundberg joined ALM Media from Penton Media, Inc., where he served as Chief Financial Officer from November 2006 to January 2008. Prior to joining Penton Media, Mr. Lundberg held various financial positions within American Lawyer Media (predecessor to ALM Media, LLC), including Vice President of Finance and Chief Financial Officer, from 1995-2006.

BioAgilytix [DURHAM, N.C.] added Todd Lynch as SVP and Chief Financial Officer. Lynch has more than 23 years’ experience with companies that include GlaxoSmithKline, Inveresk Research, and most recently, Metabolon.

Syndax Pharmaceuticals, Inc. [WALTHAM, Mass.], announced that the Company has appointed Allan L. Shaw as Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer and Secretary. Mr. Shaw is a three-time public company Chief Financial Officer. Most recently, Mr. Shaw served as a Managing Director of Alvarez & Marsal. He currently serves on the boards of directors of two public companies, Vivus Inc., and Akari Therapeutics, Plc. Mr. Shaw’s previous experience includes serving as the Chief Financial Officer of Serono S.A., NewLead Holdings Ltd. and Viatel, Inc. Mr. Shaw was also the founder and senior managing director of Shaw Strategic Capital LLC.

Ducommun Incorporated (NYSE: DCO) [LOS ANGELES] announced that Douglas L. Groves, a member of the Company’s executive leadership team, has been named vice president, chief financial officer, and treasurer, succeeding Joseph P. Bellino, who retired at the end of 2015. Mr. Groves joined Ducommun in January 2013 as vice president of accounting and moved into the vice president, controller and chief accounting officer role later that year. He joined Ducommun from Beckman Coulter, Inc., where he served as corporate vice president and chief information officer after holding a series of progressively responsible finance and accounting management positions, including vice president of finance for the North American operations.

UCP, Inc. (NYSE:UCP) [SAN JOSE, Calif.] announced that James M. Pirrello has joined the company as its Chief Financial Officer, succeeding William J. La Herran, who recently resigned. His experience includes tenures at Pulte Homes, NVR, First Homebuilders of Florida, The Fortress Group, BCB Homes and Sivage Homes.

The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf® [LOS ANGELES] is pleased to appoint Jeff Harris as Chief Financial Officer. Harris was most recently CFO/COO of Purple Wine Company. He has also served as Chief Financial Officer for fashion brands such as Stella & Dot and Gymboree and worked in finance leadership positions for entertainment companies such as Lucasfilm Ltd. and Disney.

AmpliPhi Biosciences Corporation (NYSE MKT: APHB) [SAN DIEGO] announced that Steve R. Martin has been appointed as its new Chief Financial Officer, replacing interim CFO, David E. Bosher, who will remain with AmpliPhi as a consultant. Mr. Martin served for three years as the CFO of Apricus Biosciences. Prior to Apricus, he was CFO and interim CEO of BakBone Software. Previously, Mr. Martin was senior consultant to the CEO and Acting Chief Accounting Officer for Leap Communications. Mr. Martin’s leadership experience includes serving as CFO of Stratagene Corporation and as Controller for Gen-Probe. Mr. Martin began his career at Deloitte, where he spent 10 years in its San Diego office, rising to Senior Audit Manager.

Trimble (NASDAQ: TRMB) [SUNNYVALE, Calif.] announced that Robert Painter, currently a Trimble vice president and general manager of Trimble Buildings, will become its new chief financial officer, replacing Francois Delepine, who will be leaving Trimble to pursue another opportunity. Painter assumed leadership of Trimble’s business development when he joined the company in 2006 and led all acquisition activity for three years. During that time, he played a substantial role in the creation of Virtual Site Solutions, a joint venture with Caterpillar. Subsequently, Painter was general manager for Trimble’s construction services business and then general manager for Intelligent Construction Tools, Trimble’s joint venture with Hilti. In 2015, Painter was appointed vice president for Trimble Buildings, a significant component of the Engineering and Construction segment. Prior to Trimble, he held a variety of management and finance positions at Cenveo, Rapt, Bain & Company, Whole Foods and Kraft.

Commercial Metals Company (NYSE: CMC) [IRVING, Texas] announced that its Board of Directors has promoted Mary A. Lindsey to the position of Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, replacing Barbara R. Smith who has been promoted to COO. Ms. Lindsey joined the Company in September 2009 as Vice President-Tax, and she became the Vice President-Tax and Investor Relations in June 2015. Prior to joining CMC, Ms. Lindsey served as Vice President Tax and Tax Counsel for Albany International Corp, and from January 2005 to March 2006, Ms. Lindsey was an attorney at Baker and Hostetler, a national law firm. In addition, Ms. Lindsey served in various roles, including Vice President Tax and Tax Counsel, Legal Counsel responsible for global M&A and intellectual property, and General Manager of Corporate M&A, at The Timken Company from January 1985 to January 2005.

Enable Midstream Partners, LP (NYSE: ENBL) [OKLAHOMA CITY] announced that its Board of Directors has named John Laws Executive Vice President, Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer. Laws, a 6-year Enable leader, succeeds former CFO Rod Sailor. Prior to being named CFO, Laws served as treasurer at Enable. Before joining Enable in 2010, he served various organizations in a variety of corporate finance leadership roles.

Tintri Inc. [MOUNTAIN VIEW, CA] announced that John C. Bolger has joined Tintri as its newest board member. John brings more than 30 years of accounting and financial expertise, as well as extensive public company board and senior management experience. Bolger is a retired vice president of finance and administration as well as chief financial officer for Cisco Systems Inc., and has served as audit committee chair on more than 10 boards of a variety of high tech companies.

GSC Logistics, Inc. [OAKLAND, Calif.] has promoted Marc Jensen to CFO. Mr. Jensen joined GSC Logistics in March 2015 as VP of Finance / Corporate Controller, bringing over 30 years of transportation and logistics experience to GSC Logistics. Prior to joining GSC he served as principal for MLJ Consulting LLC. Mr. Jensen previously served as VP, Corporate Controller for Pacer International, where he had earlier served as Pacer International’s head of Internal Audit. His experience also includes American President Lines (APL), APL Logistics, and the original United States Lines, serving in a variety of financial, operational, and information technology roles.

Demandbase [SAN FRANCISCO] announced that Steven Klei has joined the company’s board of directors as head of the Audit Committee, in addition to being the chief financial officer at Kabam. Klei has an impressive background, holding chief financial officer positions at a variety of successful SaaS companies including Jigsaw, ProBusiness, Autonomy, Zantaz Inc. and Xactly

Monaker Group (OTC: MKGI) [WESTON, FL] announced that Omar Jimenez has joined the Company as Chief Financial Officer (“CFO”) and Chief Operating Officer (“COO”). Mr. Jimenez has held a variety of senior financial management positions including CFO at EpiCenter Development, and President & CFO at American Leisure Holdings, Inc. Mr. Jimenez also served as Director of Operations for US Installation Group, Inc., a selling and installation group for The Home Depot, and CFO and VP of Onyx Group, Inc.

RealPage, Inc. (NASDAQ: RP) [CARROLLTON, Texas] announced that Brian Shelton will be named Interim Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer after W. Bryan Hill, Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer resigns, to pursue other opportunities and interests. Mr. Shelton previously served as Vice President of Finance for St. Jude Medical, Inc., 2010 to 2014. From 2004 to 2010, Mr. Shelton held various senior financial and operational roles at St. Jude Medical, Inc.

MSCI Inc. (NYSE: MSCI) [NEW YORK] announced that Robert Qutub, its Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer, has notified the company that he intends to retire. It is expected that Mr. Qutub will remain with the company until the earlier of mid-May and the appointment of his successor.

FireMon [OVERLAND PARK, KS] announced the appointment of Donald Klumb as Chief Financial Officer. Donald Klumb has more than 30 years of management experience including CFO of Cartesian (CRTN). Prior to Cartesian, he was an audit and consulting partner at Deloitte.

Veracity Management Global, Inc. (PINK: VCMG) [DALLAS] announced the appointment of Peter B. Dauterman to its board of directors, and will serve as Chief Financial Officer and a Director.

FCB Financial Holdings, Inc. [WESTON, Fla.] announced the appointment of Jennifer L. Simons to the post of Chief Financial Officer. Ms. Simons assumes the post from Paul D. Burner who served in the role of CFO since July 2012, and will continue with FCB in the role of Finance Director. In July 2015 Ms. Simons was promoted to Deputy Chief Financial Officer. Upon joining the Company in 2014 as Chief Accounting Officer, Ms. Simons brought over 20 years financial experience to FCB. Most recently, she was Vice President and Senior Manager at PNC Financial Services Group.

Phononic [DURHAM, N.C.] announced that Tom Werthan has been appointed Chief Financial Officer. Werthan comes to Phononic from Solid State Equipment where he was CFO. Previously, he held the CFO position at Sunlogics and Emcore. Werthan has also held finance and accounting leadership positions at Audio Visual Labs.

Willis Lease Finance Corporation (NASDAQ: WLFC) [Novato, CA,] announced that Brad Forsyth will be resigning as Chief Financial Officer, effective February 18, 2016. Following Mr. Forsyth’s departure and during the Company’s search for a permanent replacement, functions previously performed by Mr. Forsyth will be managed with existing personnel.

Federal-Mogul Holdings Corporation (NASDAQ: FDML) [Southfield, Michigan] announced that Jerome Rouquet has been appointed Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer (CFO) of Federal-Mogul Holdings Corporation. Rouquet will replace Raj Shah, Senior Vice President and CFO, Federal-Mogul Holdings Corporation, who announced his retirement. In addition to assuming the new corporate CFO responsibilities, Rouquet will continue in his role as Senior Vice President, Finance of the Motorparts division.

Mavenlink [IRVINE, Calif.] announced that it has expanded its executive team with the addition of Michael Lin to the position of CFO. Prior to joining Mavenlink, Michael was the CFO of Cake Marketing. Michael has also served as CFO of both Uniloc and Gehry Technologies. Prior to that, he was VP of Finance and Planning at enterprise search company Fast Search and Transfer.

Organovo Holdings, Inc. (NYSE MKT: ONVO) [SAN DIEGO] announced that Barry Michaels, chief financial officer (“CFO”), will retire after the end of the Company’s current fiscal year. Michaels, whose outstanding career spans over 40 years, has served as CFO since August 2011.

Restaurant Revolution Technologies, Inc. (RRT) [SAN DIEGO, CA] announced the addition of Jack Fitzpatrick as its Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer. Fitzpatrick has over 30 years of experience working with startup and emerging growth companies in a wide variety of industries. Prior to joining RRT, Fitzpatrick was COO and CFO of Skylight Healthcare Systems, Inc. Prior to Skylight, Jack was CFO at Discovery Partners (IPO), CFO at Diatek, LP (merger), CFO at Pacific Data Products (merger), and CFO at Syntro Corporation (IPO).

O2 Concepts, LLC [OKLAHOMA CITY, OK] announced the appointment of Cory Smith as Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Smith has held key leadership positions in finance and information technology for over a decade in the surgical device sector. He most recently served as an executive with Endologix (ELGX). Prior to Endologix, Mr. Smith held multiple finance management positions in the healthcare industry.

Integrated Freight Corporation (OTC PINK: IFCR) [DANBURY, CT] announced that its board of directors has appointed Jace Simmons as its Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Simmons brings over thirty years of CFO-level experience in diverse business segments including both mid and large-cap public companies.

River Valley Community Bank (OTC: RVVY) [YUBA CITY, Calif.] is pleased to announce it has appointed Michael Finn, as its Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Michael began his career in public accounting with McGladrey & Pullen LLP in Las Vegas, Nevada. Michael transitioned away from public accounting in 2006 and spent two years as the Controller for a de novo bank, Service1st Bank of Nevada. He spent the next seven years back in public accounting, including five years with Perry-Smith LLP, where he advanced to the senior manager position, and two additional years with Moss Adams LLP.

REV Group, Inc. [MIAMI, Fla.] announced that Dean Nolden has been named Chief Financial Officer (CFO). For the past 17 years, Nolden has worked with the Manitowoc Company in Manitowoc, WI. He held positions of increasing responsibility in the finance area, serving most recently as Executive Vice President Finance for Manitowoc’s Crane segment and interim CFO for its Foodservice business. Prior to that, he was Manitowoc’s VP of Finance & Treasurer.

EMC Corporation [HOPKINTON, Mass.] (NYSE: EMC) announced that Denis Cashman has been named EMC Chief Financial Officer, effective March 1. Mr. Cashman will succeed Zane Rowe, who will become Chief Financial Officer of VMware, also effective March 1. Mr. Cashman began his professional career with EMC in Ireland in 1988 as the Finance Controller for EMC’s Cork manufacturing facility. Since then, he has held numerous financial positions including European Financial Controller, International Financial Controller, Vice President of International Finance, Corporate Controller, Chief Accounting Officer and Chief Operating Officer of Finance, and most recently Chief Financial Officer for EMC Information Infrastructure and EMC’s Chief Accounting Officer.

VMware, Inc. [HOPKINTON, Mass.] announced that EMC CFO Zane Rowe will move to become VMware’s Chief Financial Officer effective March 1. The appointment is made as EMC prepares to complete its previously announced combination with Dell. Once the transaction closes, EMC will be combined with Dell and VMware will remain a publicly-traded company.

Adaptive Insights [PALO ALTO, CA] appointed Jim Johnson as CFO. Prior to joining Adaptive Insights, Johnson was CFO of TIBCO Software. He joined TIBCO through the acquisition of Jaspersoft. Prior to Jaspersoft, Johnson served as the chief financial officer of privately-held MSC Software, and VGH. Johnson’s experience also includes executive-level finance positions at VERITAS (which merged with Symantec in 2005) and 15 years at Sun Microsystems.

Visteon Corporation (NYSE: VC) [VAN BUREN TOWNSHIP, Mich.] announced that Jeffrey M. Stafeil, executive vice president and chief financial officer, will leave the company after the appointment of his successor. Stafeil has been with Visteon since October 2012.

OpenTable [SAN FRANCISCO], part of The Priceline Group, announced that Jeff McCombs has been appointed Chief Financial Officer. Prior to joining OpenTable, McCombs served as the Chief Financial Officer for Flipboard. Previously, he served as the Global Head of Business Operations for Facebook’s ad business; Chief Financial Officer and Head of Corporate and Business Development for Tumri; and in various senior executive roles at Yahoo. He began his career as an investment banker at firms including Credit Suisse First Boston and Lehman Brothers.

NASDAQ [NEW YORK] (NASDAQ: NDAQ) announced that Lee Shavel, Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President, Corporate Strategy will retire, effective March 31, 2016. Shavel joined Nasdaq in 2011 from Bank of America Merrill Lynch. Shavel has accepted a position to join the Board of Directors of a public company. Ron Hassen, Senior Vice President and Corporate Controller, Nasdaq, will serve as interim CFO, as the company conducts an active search to fill the role. Mr. Hassen has been with Nasdaq for nearly 15 years and previously served as interim Chief Financial Officer.

Lands’ End, Inc. [DODGEVILLE, Wis.] (NASDAQ: LE) announced that it has named James (Jim) Gooch EVP, Chief Operating Officer and Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Gooch most recently served as the Co-Chief Executive Officer and Chief Administrative Officer of Demoulas Supermarkets until December 2014. Prior to that, Mr. Gooch was an independent consultant Mr. Gooch previously served as the President and Chief Executive Officer, and prior to that Chief Financial Officer, of RadioShack Corporation from 2006 to 2012. Mr. Gooch is currently a member of the board of directors of Sears Hometown and Outlet stores, and has served as the chair of the board’s audit and compensation committees.

Stryker Corporation [Kalamazoo, Michigan] (NYSE: SYK) announced that William R. Jellison will retire from his role as Vice President, Chief Financial Officer. He will remain as CFO through the first quarter of 2016 to ensure a smooth transition. Glenn S. Boehnlein, who currently serves as Group CFO for MedSurg & Neurotechnology (MSNT), will assume the role of Vice President, Chief Financial Officer effective April 1, 2016. Glenn joined Stryker in 2003 as the Vice President of Finance and IT for Stryker’s Endoscopy division and has taken on roles of increasing responsibility, including his current role as Group CFO of MSNT, which he assumed in 2011. He then spent three years with Success TV as the company’s CFO prior to joining Stryker.

Southern New Hampshire Health [NASHUA, N.H.] announced that Michael S. Rose, Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer will assume the role of President and CEO, effective July 1, 2016. Prior to joining SNHH as CFO in 2007, Rose was Vice President of Finance and Operations at Cooper Health System in New Jersey.

Certent, Inc. [PLEASANTON, Calif.] announced that Wendy Nieto has joined Certent as chief financial officer (CFO). Nieto most notably served as chief financial officer at Intraware, Inc. Prior to Intraware, Nieto held various corporate accounting and finance positions at Chiron Corporation.

Great Wolf Resorts, Inc. [MADISON, Wis.] announced Gregory Kryder is joining as its new Chief Financial Officer (CFO), effective March 1, 2016. Kryder joins Great Wolf Resorts from Diageo North America, where he was CFO. For the last 14 years he has held several leadership positions across key business units at Diageo plc. Prior to joining Diageo plc, he worked for Boston Consulting Group.

Pine Brook [NEW YORK] announced the promotions of Annie Sloyer to chief financial officer. Sloyer joined Pine Brook as controller in April 2010. Prior to joining Pine Brook, she spent three years as a fund controller with Olympus Capital Holdings Asia, and more than five years as a manager at PricewaterhouseCoopers.

STAG Industrial, Inc. [BOSTON] (NYSE: STAG) announced that it and Geoffrey G. Jervis, the Company’s Chief Financial Officer, Executive Vice President and Treasurer, mutually agreed that Mr. Jervis’s employment with the Company would terminate so that Mr. Jervis could pursue other opportunities. The Company also announced the appointment of William R. Crooker as Chief Financial Officer, Executive Vice President and Treasurer. Mr. Crooker has most recently served as the Company’s Chief Accounting Officer and Senior Vice President of Capital Markets. Prior to the formation of the Company, Mr. Crooker served as the Chief Accounting Officer for the Company’s predecessor, STAG Capital Partners, LLC from 2010 to 2011. From 2002 to 2010, Mr. Crooker worked for KPMG LLP in its real estate practice focusing primarily on publicly traded real estate investment trusts.

Voce Capital Management LLC [SAN FRANCISCO] formally announced that Mark Shamia has joined as Chief Operating Officer and Chief Financial Officer.

Family Care Partners [LOS ANGELES & SUMTER, S.C.] announced that Paul A. Miller has been named Chief Financial Officer. Most recently, Miller served as the CFO of Cornerstone Healthcare. Prior to that, he was the CFO for Avizent; and before that was with U.S. Spine. Miller also served as CFO and General Counsel for CompManagement, Inc.

Albemarle Corporation [BATON ROUGE, La.] (NYSE: ALB) announced that Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer Scott A. Tozier is on a temporary medical leave of absence. Senior Vice President of Corporate Strategy and Investor Relations Matthew K. Juneau will assume management responsibility of Albemarle’s finance and accounting, tax and treasury teams.

Ryerson Holding Corporation [CHICAGO] (NYSE: RYI) announced the appointment of Erich S. Schnaufer to the position of chief financial officer (CFO). Schnaufer was previously the company’s interim chief financial officer, succeeding Edward J. Lehner who took over as president and chief executive officer in 2015. Schnaufer joined Ryerson in 2005 and was promoted in 2007 to controller and chief accounting officer responsible for accounting, tax and financial reporting. Prior to joining Ryerson, Schnaufer held senior financial and accounting management roles at several public companies including Alternative Resources Corporation and Midway Games.

Foros [NEW YORK] announced that Stellar Kim Tucker has joined the firm as Managing Director. Immediately prior to joining Foros, Stellar served as Chief Financial Officer of TCM. Prior to joining TCM in 2011, Stellar was a Managing Director and Global Co-Head of Business Services in the Investment Banking Division of Goldman, Sachs & Co.

SevOne [BOSTON] announced the appointment of Rafe Brown to the positions of Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer, and Senior Vice President. Prior to his new role, Mr. Brown served as Chief Financial Officer, Chief Administrative Officer, and Senior Vice President at Pegasystems, Inc. He was previously a Senior Vice President in the finance group at Salesforce.com. Prior to Salesforce.com, he spent five years at Cisco Systems, preceded by his public accounting years at PwC and Arthur Andersen.

White Ops [NEW YORK, NY] announced that it has appointed Barry Chubrik as chief financial officer (CFO). Most recently, he served as CFO at Get Satisfaction.

FreightCar America, Inc. [CHICAGO] (NASDAQ: RAIL) announced that it has appointed Matthew (Matt) S. Kohnke as Vice President, Finance, Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer, effective February 29, 2016. Mr. Kohnke will succeed Charles F. Avery, Jr., who left the Company by mutual consent to pursue new business opportunities. Mr. Kohnke joins the Company from Dorman Products, Inc. where he has served since 2002. He first served as Dorman’s Vice President and Corporate Controller and, in 2011, he assumed the position of Dorman’s Chief Financial Officer.

YourMembership (YM) [ST. PETERSBURG, FL] announced Michael Branca as its new Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Branca joins YourMembership from Intelident Solutions, where he was Vice President and Chief Financial Officer.

Johnny Rockets [ALISO VIEJO, Calif.] announced the appointment of Susanne Stover, who will be joining the company as its new Chief Financial Officer and member of its executive team. Prior to joining Johnny Rockets, Stover was the Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at the New York Racing Association. Susanne has held leadership positions as the Chief Financial Officer for Rosa Mexicano restaurant chain and Controller at the casual dining restaurant chain California Pizza Kitchen. Earlier in her career, Stover held positions at The Walt Disney Company, KPMG Peat Marwick and Ernst & Young.

Apollo Commercial Real Estate Finance, Inc. [NEW YORK] (NYSE: ARI) announced Megan Gaul, Chief Financial Officer, Secretary and Treasurer of ARI, resigned from the Company to pursue other interests. Ms. Gaul will remain in her positions until June 2016 and has agreed to assist the Company as it transitions her responsibilities to her replacement.

Qualys, Inc. [REDWOOD CITY, CA] (NASDAQ: QLYS) announced that Don McCauley, the company’s Chief Financial Officer, has informed the company of his intent to resign effective March 1, 2016.

USA Technologies, Inc. [MALVERN, Pa.] (NASDAQ: USAT) announced the appointment of Leland “Lee” Maxwell as interim chief financial officer (CFO); he replaces J. Duncan Smith. Mr. Maxwell served as the company’s CFO and treasurer from 1997 to 2003. Previously he has served in the roles of CFO at Nurture, Inc., and controller at MeadWestvaco, and Smurfit Stone Container. He is also Board Chair and co-founder of the DMAX Foundation.

AMERI HOLDINGS, Inc. [PRINCETON, N.J.] (OTCQB: AMRH) announced the appointment of Edward O’Donnell as Chief Financial Officer. Mr. O’Donnell has served as the Chief Operating Officer of Radbourne Property Group, Inc. Prior to Radbourne, Mr. O’Donnell served as Chief Financial Officer of AudioEye, Inc. Mr. O’Donnell served as Vice President of Finance for Augme Technologies, Inc. Mr. O’Donnell also previously served as Chief Financial Officer of Carlyle Capital Group LLC. Before Carlyle, Mr. O’Donnell served as Senior Vice President of Finance and Investor Relations of ACTV, Inc.

Arthur J. Gallagher & Co. [ITASCA, Ill.] (NYSE: AJG) announced the appointment of Ralph J. Nicoletti to the company’s Board of Directors. Mr. Nicoletti is Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Tiffany & Co. Previously, he served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer for both Cigna Corporation and Alberto Culver, Inc. He began his career at Kraft Foods, Inc. where he served in various financial leadership roles including Senior Vice President Corporate Audit at Kraft Foods, Inc. and Senior Vice President Finance of Kraft North America.

Optima Healthcare Solutions [PALM CITY, Fla. and ATLANTA] announced that Pat Clark has been appointed Chief Financial Officer. Pat has more than twenty years experience as a financial executive in healthcare and other industries, having served as Chief Financial Officer at Wellcentive, Vocalocity and The Weather Channel.

Orangetheory® Fitness [FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla.] announced Tim Tanguay joined the company’s executive leadership team as chief financial officer. Prior to joining Orangetheory Fitness, Tanguay most recently served as chief financial officer for Tropical Smoothie Café.

JetSmarter [NEW YORK] announced the appointment of Joseph A. Epstein as Chief Financial Officer. Prior to his role at JetSmarter, Epstein served as a Director of McGladrey, LLP. JetSmarter’s current Chief Financial Officer, Gennady Barsky has been promoted to President of the company.

Piper Jaffray Companies [MINNEAPOLIS] (NYSE: PJC) announced that Sherry M. Smith joined its board of directors. Most recently, Smith was the executive vice president and chief financial officer of SUPERVALU, INC., where she also held the role of vice president, senior vice president of finance and corporate controller from 1998 to 2002 and treasurer from 2002 to 2005. She is currently an independent director at both Deere & Company and Tuesday Morning Corporation along with a committee member at Realogy Holdings Corp.

Surna Inc. [BOULDER, Colorado] (OTCQB: SRNA) announced that it has terminated the services of Douglas McKinnon as Chief Financial Officer. On January 21, 2016, the Board appointed Ellen White to serve as its Chief Financial Officer. Ms. White was serving as the Company’s Director of Finance since September 2015. Her prior experience includes CFO at the National Sports Center for the Disabled (NSCD). Prior to NSCD, she was the Vice President of Financial Planning & Analysis at Healthgrades in Denver. Ms. White started her career in public accounting at EY and KPMG and then spent 13 years at Microsoft Corporation in a variety of finance and strategy roles.

Juniper Networks [SUNNYVALE, CA] (NYSE: JNPR) announced that Robyn Denholm notified the Company of her intention to resign as chief financial and operations officer following the filing of the Company’s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended Dec. 31, 2015, and is expected to remain at the Company over the next several months to help facilitate a smooth transition. Based on the Company’s succession planning, the Company announced its plans to appoint Ken Miller, the Company’s senior vice president, finance, to succeed Denholm as chief financial officer.

WSFS Financial Corporation [WILMINGTON, Del.] (NASDAQ:WSFS), the parent company of WSFS Bank, announced that they are resuming their search for a new Chief Financial Officer. Kevin L. Thompson, who was recently named Chief Financial Officer, has decided to remain with his family in Utah and will not be joining the company. Rodger Levenson, Executive Vice President and Chief Corporate Development Officer who previously served as Chief Commercial Banking Officer, will continue to serve as the interim Chief Financial Officer.

Noxilizer, Inc. [Baltimore, MD] announced David A. Theil as their new Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Most recently, he worked as interim and contract CFO in the medical device and clinical diagnostics arenas. Previous industry employment appointments include: Supernus Pharmaceuticals, Specialty Pharmaceuticals; Psychiatric Genomics, Biotechnology R&D Drug Discovery; and IGEN International, Instrumentation and Diagnostics.

SMTC Corporation [SAN JOSE, Calif.] (NASDAQ: SMTX), announced the appointment of Roger Dunfield as Chief Financial Officer. He joins SMTC from Sanmina Corporation where he has been employed as Vice President, Finance & Controller in Sanmina’s Interconnect Division since 2010. Prior to joining Sanmina, he held a number of finance positions of increasing responsibility for Merix Corporation.

Autoscribe Corporation [JACKSONVILLE, Fla.] announced that Myles Locke has joined its organization to serve as its Chief Financial Officer. Locke was Vice President of Finance and Vice President of Corporate Development responsibilities at Global Payments.
